It has been said of the most polished writer in America that his matchless style is “the product of forgotten toil.'' The man who would undertake to say that his Latin study did not do him a large Service, simply because he cannot recall any of the lines of the texts he read, certainly has small claim on our consideration. He is simply hunting for an argument where there is none.
